ygData.msgSnippet: Firestorm: ok, you may wish to note that you cannot justify the bringing the shields down, because you controlled the guns of the Iron Fist which is illegal.

Firestorm: 
ok, you may wish to note that you cannot justify the bringing the 
shields down, because you controlled the guns of the Iron Fist 
which is illegal. As I think that Alloran already said (and probably 
me) read, read, re-read the rule, until you know them front to 
backwards.

This rpg may be freeform, but we placed in structural forces to 
keep the rpg fun for everyone who plays in it. It is too easy to fall 
into an arms race in this type of rpg. Have you been to the rpg's 
web page yet? That's where you'll find the rules, and all other 
information you may need... welllll, maybe not all of the information 
that you need, but you can email any of the council members 
about questions that you may have.

Soulstice:
If you don't like thecode@... so much, then why don't you 
get another?


On 16 Jul 2001, at 16:48, dewboy30816@... wrote:

> I'll admit I broke the rules, but something is misunderstood about my
> post in a vast amount. I did not bring down the shields, they were
> brought down when the "Iron Fist" fired the main turret twice from the
> power loss.
